text.p: These are the leading stories in the Beirut press on Friday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
-Lebanon and Eygpt reached an agreement over bilateral trade relations during Prime Minister Hariri's one-day visit to Cairo.
-Israeli planes hit an area in northeast Lebanon near the Syrian borders.
-Prime Minister Hariri said:" Israel is burrying peace in the region".
-After their one-day strike on Thursday, workers at public utilities decided to stage a two-day strike on March 26 to further pressure the government to meet their pay demands.
-The Bank of Lebanon issued certificates of deposit dated March 21 to commercial banks worth 93 billion Lebanese pounds.
-A Beirut court sentenced to jail six Lebanese men after finding them guilty of smuggling forged dollars to Turkey and Africa.
